entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main character of the story, a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. He is described as feeling warm and sleepy, looking up at the High Table, and experiencing pain on his forehead.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: The gamekeeper at Hogwarts, drinking from a goblet at the High Table. He is described as being present in the scene but not directly interacting with Harry.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: A professor at Hogwarts, talking to Professor Dumbledore at the High Table. She is described as being present in the scene but not directly interacting with Harry.

entities.name: professor dumbledore
entities.description: The headmaster of Hogwarts, talking to Professor McGonagall at the High Table. He is described as being present in the scene but not directly interacting with Harry.

entities.name: professor quirrell
entities.description: A professor at Hogwarts, wearing an absurd turban and talking to a teacher with greasy black hair. He is described as being present in the scene and interacting with another character.

entities.name: percy
entities.description: Harry's friend or classmate, who is asked by Harry about the identity of a teacher talking to Professor Quirrell. He is described as being present in the scene and interacting with Harry.

entities.name: teacher with greasy black hair
entities.description: A teacher at Hogwarts, described as having greasy black hair, a hooked nose, and sallow skin. He is described as talking to Professor Quirrell and looking directly into Harry's eyes.

relationships.description: The teacher looked past Quirrell’s turban straight into Harry’s eyes – and a sharp, hot pain shot across the scar on Harry’s forehead.
‘Who’s that teacher talking to Professor Quirrell?’ he asked Percy.
